  • Method Details

    • createEventToUser

      @PostMapping(path="/single/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createEventToUser(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event event, @PathVariable Integer userId)
      This method creates an event entered by the user and writes it to the DB.
      Parameters:
      event - - gets an event entered by the user. id is generated automatically for the event.
      userId - - the owner of the created event.
      Returns:
      in case of success the created event, in case failure a custom error message.

    • createEventsToUser

      @PostMapping(path="/list/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createEventsToUser(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event> events, @PathVariable Integer userId)
      This method creates an List of events entered by the user and writes it to the DB.
      Parameters:
      events - - gets List of events entered by the user.
      userId - - the owner of the created events.
      Returns:
      in case of success the created events, in case failure a custom error message.

    • addGuestsToEvent

      @PostMapping(path="/guests/{eventId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addGuestsToEvent(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.User> users, @PathVariable Integer eventId) throws ajbc.doodle.calendar.daos.DaoException
      This method adds List of guests to an event entered by the user and writes it to the DB.
      Parameters:
      users - - gets a List of users to add to a specific event.
      eventId - - the event id to add the List of users entered.
      Returns:
      - in case of success the created events, in case failure a custom error message.
      Throws:
      ajbc.doodle.calendar.daos.DaoException

    • getAllEvents

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllEvents()
      This method sends all events that exist in the DB.
      Returns:
      return a List of all events in DB.

    • getEventById

      @GetMapping(path="/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEventById(@PathVariable Integer id)
      This method sends an event from the DB by entered id from user. In case such event does not exists an error message is returned.
      Parameters:
      id - - the id of the requested event.
      Returns:

    • getEventsForUser

      @GetMapping(path="/user/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEventsForUser(@RequestParam Map<String,String> map, @PathVariable Integer id)
      This method send custom events for specific user. It receives @RequestParam map with keys & values of required operations. The default is to get all events for a user. values: 'start' + 'end' represent events of a user in a range between start date and time to end date and time. value: 'future' represent upcoming events of a user. values: 'minutes' + 'hours' represent events of a user the next coming num of minutes and hours.
      Parameters:
      map -
      id -
      Returns:

    • getEventsByRange

      @GetMapping(path="/range") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEventsByRange(@RequestParam Map<String,String> map)
      This method send custom events. values: 'start' + 'end' are LocalDateTime variables which represent events in a range between start date and time to end date and time.
      Parameters:
      map - with keys & values of required operations.
      Returns:
      range of events between the requested values.

    • updateEvent

      @PutMapping(path="/{eventId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateEvent(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event event, @PathVariable Integer eventId)
      This method update an event in the database. NOTE - in case the event does not exist a custom message will be sent.
      Parameters:
      event - - the event object to enter.
      eventId - - the id of the event to update.
      Returns:
      the updated event.

    • updateListEvents

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateListEvents(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event> events)
      This method update a List of events in the database. NOTE - in case the event does not exist a custom message will be sent.
      Parameters:
      events - - the list of the events to update.
      Returns:
      the updates events.

    • deleteEvent

      @DeleteMapping(path="/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteEvent(@RequestParam Map<String,String> map, @PathVariable Integer id)
      This method deletes an event by 2 options: 1. soft delete 2. hard delete. soft delete - set a flag for this event. hard delete - erase the event from the DB.
      Parameters:
      map - contains key and value of the required method type to delete.
      id - is the event id required to delete.
      Returns:
      the deleted event is case of success, or a costume message error in case of failure.

    • deleteListOfEvents

      @DeleteMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteListOfEvents(@RequestParam Map<String,String> map, @RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.Event> events)
      This method deletes List of events by 2 options: 1. soft delete 2. hard delete. soft delete - set a flag for the events. hard delete - erase the events from the DB.
      Parameters:
      map - contains key and value of the required method type to delete.
      events - is the list of events required to delete.
      Returns:
      the deleted events is case of success, or a costume message error in case of failure.
